Reading in data regarding Pokemon.

```{r}
pokemon <- readr::read_csv('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/main/data/2025/2025-04-01/pokemon_df.csv')
```

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(ggplot2)

ggplot(pokemon, aes(x = weight, y = defense)) +
  geom_point()

# data where a pokemon appears for each type it is
pokemon_long <- pokemon |> pivot_longer(
  names_to = NULL,
  cols = starts_with("type_"),
  values_to = "type",
  values_drop_na = TRUE
)

pokemon_long <- pokemon_long |> pivot_longer(
  names_to = NULL,
  cols = starts_with("egg_group_"),
  values_to = "egg_group",
  values_drop_na = TRUE
)

pokemon_type <- pokemon_long |> group_by(type, egg_group) |> summarise(n_pokemon = n())

pokemon_type <- pokemon_type |> unite("type_egg", type:egg_group)

pokemon_type <- pokemon_type |> arrange(desc(n_pokemon)) |> slice(1:10) |> mutate(type_egg = fct_reorder(type_egg, n_pokemon))


ggplot(pokemon_type, aes(x = type_egg, y = n_pokemon)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "identity")

```

```{r}
pokemon_plot <- pokemon_long |> group_by(type) |> mutate(median = median(defense)) |> ungroup() |> mutate(type = fct_reorder(type, median))

ggplot(pokemon_plot, aes(x = type, y = defense)) +
  geom_boxplot(fill = "pink", color = "hotpink3") + 
  theme_linedraw()

bug <- pokemon_long |> filter(type == "bug")
```
